body: @markusweimer Thanks for the one more review! I made the change for the last comment, rebased it with master.  Would you mind to merge it? Thanks!
done with another pass.
Sure, I will merge after the build server results come in.
@markusweimer I've addressed your comments, please have another look. Thanks!

Would it make sense to create a mirror of the `YARNConfiguration` class from Java in C#? At least the fields we care about? We could even make it injectable and have accessor methods for the fields we need.

Travis  was passed in previous commit.
Apache AppVeyor stuck for some reason. Here is the result from my private build on AppVeyor. It is passed.

Also I assume REEF-1408 would be done immediately after this to maintain continuity?

@afchung already puts his final comment, @markusweimer final one is for the "////" which I have removed. Do you want them to say something like sign off? 

As soon as this one is merged to master, I will send REEF-1408 for review. It has dependency on this PR.
@dkm2110 in fact, since current IMRU driver doesn't send task close event anywhere, the change shouldn't impact any test result. But no harm to give a try.
@jwang98052  I will test and merge today.
@dkm2110 Thanks!
@jwang98052 Can you do merge and rebase with latest REEF bits. When I tried to pull the branch I got conflicts. Let me know when it is done.

AppVeyor testing passed in my repository. 
https://ci.appveyor.com/project/jwang98052/reef/build/7-REEF-1392

I completed a pass. My main  concern is if you wrap all the task exceptions with TaskClientCodeException, that would not allow Task to throw different types of exceptions. Task exception can be caused by app, group communication, etc.
@markusweimer @jwang98052 I've addressed your comments, please have another look. Thanks!
LGTM, will merge.
LGTM
Tested with 10 Evaluators requested on start and 10 more Evaluators requested on restart on HDInsight.

@markusweimer There is already a `YarnClientConfiguration` in C#, which I believe kind of parallels the Java `YarnConfiguration`. I've also addressed your CR comment. Please have another look, thanks!

The `YarnClientConfiguration` we have is for REEF's YARN client, right? What I meant was to create a class that represents YARN's Java class called `YarnConfiguration`. It is instantiated off of the various `.xml` configuration files Hadoop uses and gives accessor methods (constants, really) to access the various keys in them.
@markusweimer I see. I think it's a good idea, but it's a much larger undertaking than what this PR calls for. Should we open a JIRA item for it?

By the way, I don't really like putting the YARN static class in Utilities since it's runtime dependent; however, creating a new project seems too aggressive. Do you think it's fine leaving it there for now? Maybe we can add an `Unstable` to it?

> it's a much larger undertaking than what this PR calls for. Should we open a JIRA item for it?

Agreed. I was just wondering whether we should start with the couple of configuration keys we need now here, and keep adding to them as we need more. I don't think it is wise for us to blindly create access methods for all configuration options without a clear use case.
Done with a pass.
Done with a pass. Looks good overall. One design question came to mind: What if the FailedTask isn't a C# Task, but a Java task. REEF allows a C# Driver to orchestrate Java Evaluators, after all.
I completed this pass. Looks good except couple of comments for clarification.

I'll merge.
Looks good, I'll merge.
Done with a pass.

@markusweimer is that feature actually feasible today through our provided APIs? If so, it's coverage we need to add to our suite of C# tests. If not I think we should open a JIRA and worry about it later.
I've also addressed your comments, please have another look. Thanks!

We have an example which uses a Java Driver to orchestrate .NET Tasks. I don't think we have the reverse.

@markusweimer replied to your comments. The current design only reports the earliest `Exception` to the user. In terms of when we encounter multiple `Exception` s, which idea seems better? Would like your input before implementing the next iteration. Thanks!
